text:
â€œThe 98% claim (from 2009) was based on a single survey by a University of Illinois professor and a graduate student. They sent a 2-minute online survey to 10,257 earth scientists. They got 3,146 responses to only these two questionsâ€¦â€
The first question asked, â€œWhen compared with pre-1800 levels, do you think that mean global temperatures have generally risen, fallen, or remained relatively constant?â€ The second asked, â€œDo you think that human activity is a significant contributing factor in changing mean global temperatures?â€
Ninety percent of the respondents said that the mean temp had risen, while 82 percent said that human activity was a significant factor. However, the term â€œsignificantâ€ was never defined. Furthermore, according to the Heartland Institute, most skeptic scientists would agree with the statistic if the term was defined.
The video explains that when formulating the 97 percent statistic, researchers used only the responses from â€œclimate scientists.â€ However, only 5 percent of the respondents â€“ 79 people â€“ were climate scientists.

So, out of 10,257 academics that the professor and graduate student identified as worthy survey participants, only 79 were in agreement with their final finding. When calculated, those 79 scientists â€“ now accepted as 97 percent - make up a meager 0.77 percent of academics. And, since only 97 percent of the 79 answered positively (which would be 76.63 people â€“ so we will round to 77), the percentage shrinks from 0.77 percent to 0.75 percent.



https://www.intellectualtakeout.org/article/do-97-scientists-really-believe-global-warming

text:
TOP 10 FACTS CLIMATE CHANGE FANATICS DON'T WANT YOU TO KNOW

1. The current global warming started about 12,000 years ago. That's how the last ice age ended and the current geological period, the Holocene, began. This warm and cozy climate won't last forever. Interglacial periods last between 20,000 and 60,000 years.

2. The rate at which the sea level is rising now is much lower compared to how it rose between 12,000 and 7,000 years ago â€“ a period in which the sea level rose by 197 ft (60 m). Look up the Early Holocene Sea Level Rise if you want to learn more.

3. The climate is always changing. There is no such thing as a stable climate. If you want to learn more about the "stability" of the climate, you might want to look up:
â€“ The 8.2 Kiloyear Event
â€“ The Little Ice Age
â€“ The Year Without a Summer (1816)

4. Chaos Theory tells us why the behavior of some systems is unpredictable (chaotic). Even simple systems can exhibit chaotic behavior, like the double pendulum. No one can predict the climate, because the climate is a stupidly complex chaotic system.

5. Compared to water, COâ‚‚ plays an insignificant role in the global greenhouse effect. Because â€“ and I'm not making this up â€“ 95% of all greenhouse gases is water vapor. 

6.  During the Hirnantian glaciation the atmospheric COâ‚‚ levels were 10â€“16 times higher than today. 

7. COâ‚‚ is not a pollutant. COâ‚‚ is plant food. Almost all the oxygen in the atmosphere is a byproduct of photosynthesis â€“ a process by which plants use light energy to produce glucose from COâ‚‚ and water. Without COâ‚‚ plants die. Without plants, we die. COâ‚‚ is used in the food industry, for example, in the production of carbonated beverages like: beer, soda, sparkling water etc. COâ‚‚ is also used in hospitals, for example, in laparoscopic surgery. There are real pollutants out there we should be worried about and COâ‚‚ is not one of them.

8. Compared to astronomical factors like solar activity or the Milankovitch Cycles or terrestrial factors like volcanic activity, human activity has an insignificant effect in the long term evolution of the climate. We cannot start, end, or prevent ice ages or global warmings. We're not a type I civilization.

9. This may came as a shock to you, but we're actually in the middle of a 2.58-million-year-old glaciation â€“ the Quaternary Glaciation â€“ look it up!

10.  There are many scientists who disagree with various aspects of anthropogenic climate change. One of them is Ivar Giaever, Nobel laureate in physics, who said that "Global Warming is pseudoscience". Freeman Dyson said that "Climate Change predictions are absurd". Wikipedia has a List of scientists who disagree with the scientific consensus on global warming, but it only contains the names of those scientists "who have their own Wikipedia article." Keep in mind that science doesn't work by consensus. Science isn't a democracy. As Carl Sagan put it:

â€œScience is more than a body of knowledge. It is a way of thinking; a way of skeptically interrogating the universe with a fine understanding of human fallibility. If we are not able to ask skeptical questions, to interrogate those who tell us that something is true, to be skeptical of those in authority, then, we are up for grabs for the next charlatan (political or religious) who comes rambling along.â€

In general, when you're convinced of your truth, make an effort to get out of the echo chamber and listen to a skeptic scientist who doesn't share your beliefs on the subject.

text:
1.  There are no credible scientists that claim climate would remain absolutely constant we're it not for human activity.  Thus there is no debate.  Climate change is real.

2. There is plenty of undisputed evidence of historical major and rapid climate change in scientific records.  Most of which occured without human influence.  There is no debate. Rapid climate change is natural.

3. Given that a changing climate is just part of the natural order, no locality can claim a "right" to their "current" climate.  In a changing climate, there are both winners and losers.  If extreme changes lead to depopulation, as it has in the past, this is also just part of the natural order.

4.  The only open question is whether humans are contributing to the "rate" of change.  And if so, is it really of a negative consequence, or just a rebalancing of the climate lottery.   

5. Given man's recent record of using climate change scare tacticts for personal and political gain, while continuing in their own carbon intensive ways, I am trusting that nature will correct the problem, not man.
author: jim b 15122

text: It was my friends birthday so we decided to go to a nice diner for some coffee and desert.  As we looked over the desert menu we could not help but notice the people sitting across from us were eating a very delicious looking chocolate cake.  We couldn't find it on the menu so when the waitress came over we told her that we would have 2 pieces of whatever cake the table across from us was eating.  The waitress brought us our cake and coffee and let us sample a new cookie the baker had made that day.  My friend and I were maybe into our 3rd bite of our delicious chocolate cake when we realized we were being approached by the people sitting across from us that gave us the wonderful idea to order the chocolate cake.  I couldn't think why they were coming over to our table - i thought maybe just to say hello - maybe they over heard us talking about my friends birthday - maybe they wanted to wish her a happy birthday - maybe they just wanted to see if we enjoyed the chocolate cake as much as they did.  I put down my fork and smiled as they approached .  "DO YOU KNOW HOW FATTENING CHOCOLATE CAKE IS"?  I had a total stranger barking in my ear causing a scene.  I could not believe what was going on.  Were you not just eating the same cake i kept thinking to myself...for heavens sake i got the idea from you - you were eating the same cake.  "CHOCOLATE CAKE IS NO GOOD FOR YOU!!!!" DO YOU KNOW WHAT A FAT PIG YOU LOOK LIKE EATING IT?" YOU AND YOUR FRIEND MISS PIGGY SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF YOURSELVES EATING THAT CHOCOLATE CAKE". And all the while she is yelling at me all i could do is stare at the chocolate on her chin she missed with her  napkin.  The manager finally came over and asked them to leave.  My friend and i sat quietly finishing our cake and coffee wondering what the heck just happened.  The manager picked up our tab wished my friend a Happy Birthday and we left.  *And this is how i feel about people who scream climate change into the face of others*  You might believe in something - just like the lady believed the cake was fattening - but only if someone else is eating it.

text:
According to the Vostok Ice Core Records, CO2 level changes have followed Earth's overall temperature changes at an 800 year lag for the last 800,000 years.  That means that our current CO2 levels are the result of Earth's overall temperature 800 years ago.  World leaders have convinced their dependents that this works in the reverse order, relatively quickly, and that we are to blame, so that they can tax us out of a false shared guilt in order to be able to afford to "fight" climate change, an unstoppable natural cycle.  The following is the source of this information:

Historical Carbon Dioxide Record from the Vostok Ice Core

Investigators
J.-M. Barnola, D. Raynaud, C. Lorius
Laboratoire de Glaciologie et de GÃ©ophysique de l'Environnement,
CNRS, BP96,
38402 Saint Martin d'Heres Cedex, France

N.I. Barkov
Arctic and Antarctic Research Institute,
Beringa Street 38, 199397,
St. Petersburg, Russia

Period of Record
417,160 - 2,342 years BP

Methods
In January 1998, the collaborative ice-drilling project between Russia, the United States, and France at the Russian Vostok station in East Antarctica yielded the deepest ice core ever recovered, reaching a depth of 3,623 m (Petit et al. 1997, 1999). Ice cores are unique with their entrapped air inclusions enabling direct records of past changes in atmospheric trace-gas composition. Preliminary data indicate the Vostok ice-core record extends through four climate cycles, with ice slightly older than 400 kyr (Petit et al. 1997, 1999). Because air bubbles do not close at the surface of the ice sheet but only near the firn-ice transition (that is, at ~90 m below the surface at Vostok), the air extracted from the ice is younger than the surrounding ice (Barnola et al. 1991). Using semiempirical models of densification applied to past Vostok climate conditions, Barnola et al. (1991) reported that the age difference between air and ice may be ~6000 years during the coldest periods instead of ~4000 years, as previously assumed. Ice samples were cut with a bandsaw in a cold room (at about -15Â°C) as close as possible to the center of the core in order to avoid surface contamination (Barnola et al. 1983). Gas extraction and measurements were performed with the "Grenoble analytical setup," which involved crushing the ice sample (~40 g) under vacuum in a stainless-steel container without melting it, expanding the gas released during the crushing in a pre-evacuated sampling loop, and analyzing the CO2 concentrations by gas chromatography (Barnola et al. 1983). The analytical system, except for the stainless-steel container in which the ice was crushed, was calibrated for each ice sample measurement with a standard mixture of CO2 in nitrogen and oxygen. For further details on the experimental procedures and the dating of the successive ice layers at Vostok, see Barnola et al. (1987, 1991), Lorius et al. (1985), and Petit et al. (1999).

Trends
There is a close correlation between Antarctic temperature and atmospheric concentrations of CO2 (Barnola et al. 1987). The extension of the Vostok CO2 record shows that the main trends of CO2 are similar for each glacial cycle. Major transitions from the lowest to the highest values are associated with glacial-interglacial transitions. During these transitions, the atmospheric concentrations of CO2 rises from 180 to 280-300 ppmv (Petit et al. 1999). The extension of the Vostok CO2 record shows the present-day levels of CO2 are unprecedented during the past 420 kyr. Pre-industrial Holocene levels (~280 ppmv) are found during all interglacials, with the highest values (~300 ppmv) found approximately 323 kyr BP. When the Vostok ice core data were compared with other ice core data (Delmas et al. 1980; Neftel et al. 1982) for the past 30,000 - 40,000 years, good agreement was found between the records: all show low CO2 values [~200 parts per million by volume (ppmv)] during the Last Glacial Maximum and increased atmospheric CO2 concentrations associated with the glacial-Holocene transition. According to Barnola et al. (1991) and Petit et al. (1999) these measurements indicate that, at the beginning of the deglaciations, the CO2 increase either was in phase or lagged by less than ~1000 years with respect to the Antarctic temperature, whereas it clearly lagged behind the temperature at the onset of the glaciations.

References
Barnola, J.-M., D. Raynaud, A. Neftel, and H. Oeschger. 1983. Comparison of CO2 measurements by two laboratories on air from bubbles in polar ice. Nature 303:410-13.

Barnola, J.-M., D. Raynaud, Y.S. Korotkevich, and C. Lorius. 1987. Vostok ice core provides 160,000-year record of atmospheric CO2. Nature 329:408-14.

Barnola, J.-M., P. Pimienta, D. Raynaud, and Y.S. Korotkevich. 1991. CO2-climate relationship as deduced from the Vostok ice core: A re-examination based on new measurements and on a re-evaluation of the air dating. Tellus 43(B):83- 90.

Delmas, R.J., J.-M. Ascencio, and M. Legrand. 1980. Polar ice evidence that atmospheric CO2 20,000 yr BP was 50% of present. Nature 284:155-57.

Jouzel, J., C. Lorius, J.R. Petit, C. Genthon, N.I. Barkov, V.M. Kotlyakov, and V.M. Petrov. 1987. Vostok ice core: A continuous isotopic temperature record over the last climatic cycle (160,000 years). Nature 329:403-8.

Lorius, C., J. Jouzel, C. Ritz, L. Merlivat, N.I. Barkov, Y.S. Korotkevich, and V.M. Kotlyakov. 1985. A 150,000-year climatic record from Antarctic ice. Nature 316:591-96.

Neftel, A., H. Oeschger, J. Schwander, B. Stauffer, and R. Zumbrunn. 1982. Ice core measurements give atmospheric CO2 content during the past 40,000 yr. Nature 295:220-23.

Pepin, L., D. Raynaud, J.-M. Barnola, and M.F. Loutre. 2001. Hemispheric roles of climate forcings during glacial-interglacial transitions as deduced from the Vostok record and LLN-2D model experiments. Journal of Geophysical Research 106 (D23): 31,885-31,892.

Petit, J.R., I. Basile, A. Leruyuet, D. Raynaud, C. Lorius, J. Jouzel, M. Stievenard, V.Y. Lipenkov, N.I. Barkov, B.B. Kudryashov, M. Davis, E. Saltzman, and V. Kotlyakov. 1997. Four climate cycles in Vostok ice core. Nature 387: 359-360.

Petit, J.R., J. Jouzel, D. Raynaud, N.I. Barkov, J.-M. Barnola, I. Basile, M. Benders, J. Chappellaz, M. Davis, G. Delayque, M. Delmotte, V.M. Kotlyakov, M. Legrand, V.Y. Lipenkov, C. Lorius, L. PÃ©pin, C. Ritz, E. Saltzman, and M. Stievenard. 1999. Climate and atmospheric history of the past 420,000 years from the Vostok ice core, Antarctica. Nature 399: 429-436.

Raynaud, D., and J.-M. Barnola. 1985. An Antarctic ice core reveals atmospheric CO2 variations over the past few centuries. Nature 315:309-11.

CITE AS: Barnola, J.-M., D. Raynaud, C. Lorius, and N.I. Barkov. 2003. Historical CO2 record from the Vostok ice core. In Trends: A Compendium of Data on Global Change. Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center, Oak Ridge National Laboratory, U.S. Department of Energy, Oak Ridge, Tenn., U.S.A.

Revised February 2003

text:
Â @Christopher PuzzoÂ "Since 1979, satellites have provided a consistent continuous record of sea ice. Through 2015, the average monthly September extent of Arctic sea ice has declined by 13.4 percent per decade relative to the average from 1981 to 2010. Declines are occurring in every geographic area, in every month, and every season. Natural variability and rising temperatures linked to global warming appear to have played a role in this decline. The Arctic may be ice-free in summer before the end of this century.

Antarctic sea ice trends are smaller and more complex. Relative to the average from 1981 to 2010, the Antarctic sea ice extent increased about 1 percent per decade, but the trends were not consistent for all areas or all seasons. The variability in Antarctic sea ice patterns makes it harder for scientists to explain Antarctic sea ice trends and to predict how Southern Hemisphere sea ice may change as greenhouse gases continue to warm the Earth. Climate models do predict that Antarctic sea ice will respond more slowly than Arctic sea ice to warming, but as temperatures continue to rise, a long-term decline is expected." 
Source:  https://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/search?q=sea+ice

author: Cyril Riceball

text:
Â @Cyril RiceballÂ  Carbon 13 and Carbon 12 are almost the same. The extra neutron does not generally affect chemical reactions, so carbon dioxide can exist with either isotope of carbon. Plants exhibit a small preference for absorbing C12 because C12 is lighter than C13 and therefore can pass through the cell wall more readily. 


The C13/C12 ratio of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere gives us a baseline. We know the C13/C12 ratio in atmospheric carbon dioxide has been steadily decreasing; the only explanation for this is carbon dioxide created from plant matter. This is consistent with combustion of fossil fuels and not consistent with other releases like volcanos, etc which are primarily geological and therefore have a higher C13/C12 ratio.
author: Appable

text:

Climate change deniers clearly believe that the human species can continue on regardless - increasing in size and consuming in ever larger quantities the limited resources of the planet without any real consequence. They must therefore believe that the planet's resources are unbounded - unlimited - perhaps this illogical thinking is underpinned by religious belief - it certainly isn't supported by rational thought. No one in their right mind would suggest that the resources of this planet are limitless - everything has limits - even a fisherman will tell you that - when he looks in the basket and sees only 2 fish - that's barely enough 'bread' to feed his family let alone 5000 people. 

In the history of this planet whenever a species became over dominant nature brought back the balance. There's a very simple fact - if man doesn't control his own numbers - nature will. The signs are all around us now. From every country in the world - reports come flooding in - rising water levels - poor water quality - perma ice levels - insect, bird, plant species population collapse - in rapidly changing temperatures - in reduced food supply - in the weather - the air quality etc. etc. Surely even if you aren't a climate change supporter - logic should tell you that the human race needs to change the way it manages the resources of this planet - it makes good sense - even a fisherman will tell you that conservation is important to sustain their livelihood. text:
Climate Change the Hoax
It's really simple, the Climate Change people are telling the world that the oceans are and have already risen. They show us a picture of some remote island that nobody has ever been to. But "If" the seas have already risen then why is the High Tide lines still in the same place they were a century ago? I'm talking about Florida, a place where we all have been or seen and know, and their beaches are well marked by sea walls and sand dunes, established lines and boundaries that prove the seas have not risen in the last century!
Sure the Leftists can find a small island that never dredged to rebuild their coastlines. In Florida we have been repairing our beaches with dredging for decades now. This is because for thousands of years there has been Storm Surge that decays the dunes, and the need to dredge is necessary for the tourist beach industry. Some places are losing top soil to the oceans because the inhabitants have stripped the land of trees & shrubs that used their roots to keep the ground from being washed away. This is not climate change, instead its negligence.
Climate Change Fanatics have claimed that the problem has been going on for centuries and most recently are claiming ice melts sending "Gazillions" of gallons of water to the oceans have already caused the 'seas to rise.' Well Archimedes Law of Water Displacement means Florida's high tide lines should be over the roads by now but are not. Finding some small island that has never dredged nor protected their top soil is not proof of the seas rising. AND some claim that putting things in the oceans for the last thousand years may be the real cause of any minor evidence of water displacement evidence! When the Climate Change Fanatics can show me one 'major' beach that is being flooded by oceans rise then I will believe them. AND don't show me the pics of a "King tide" or moon tide that is caused by the alignment of the moon & sun periodically. That too is not evidence of climate change. The Leftists tried to portray some water in Miami washing over the sidewalks along Miami Beach as proof of climate change, when it was proved to be a moon tide only.
How despicable the Leftist Communists are to try and use "The Sky is Falling" or the Climate Change Hoax to further the cause of Socialism. They really are slavers with a desire to conquer the world like many others who have tried in history past. Now the new Genghis Khan, Alexander the Great, Napoleon and Hitler is Global Communists using an army of alleged scientists to create mass hysteria. We will defeat them like we defeated all the armies of slavery before!
The use of science as a propaganda weapon was advanced by the Nazis in WW2 when they created scientific evidence against the Jews. After the US Civil War the Democrats rebuilt their party with the help of the College & University crowd that were touting the Missing Link Theory in Darwin's Evolution. That being blacks from the west coast of Africa were the missing link or half human and half monkey. It poured fuel on the hate in the Jim Crow era and was only removed by schools in the 1930s and 40's. The scientific community is for the most part civil servants and college funded people that cannot 'get rich' in their profession. Hard to believe that even NASA scientists could be corrupted, but those without God no matter how intelligent they are at math and science harbor deceit and personal desires for wealth and power. Climate Change is allowing scientists to lay claim on the leadership of the world and that makes them dangerous. They are all gone aside, they are all together become filthy: there is none that doeth good, no, not one.
Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread, and call not upon the LORD.
There were they in great fear: for God is in the generation of the righteous.

2 Peter 3:3-14  Knowing this first, that there shall come in the last days scoffers, walking after their own lusts,
And saying, Where is the promise of his coming? for since the fathers fell asleep, all things continue as they were from the beginning of the creation.
For this they willingly are ignorant of, that by the word of God the heavens were of old, and the earth standing out of the water and in the water:
Whereby the world that then was, being overflowed with water, perished:
But the heavens and the earth, which are now, by the same word are kept in store, reserved unto fire against the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men.
But, beloved, be not ignorant of this one thing, that one day is with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.
The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.
But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in the which the heavens shall pass away with a great noise, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat, the earth also and the works that are therein shall be burned up.
Seeing then that all these things shall be dissolved, what manner of persons ought ye to be in all holy conversation and godliness,
Looking for and hasting unto the coming of the day of God, wherein the heavens being on fire shall be dissolved, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat?
Nevertheless we, according to his promise, look for new heavens and a new earth, wherein dwelleth righteousness.
Wherefore, beloved, seeing that ye look for such things, be diligent that ye may be found of him in peace, without spot, and blameless.

The area that is now Gateway Mall, along with most of the Springâ€…Creek neighborhood, originally consisted of marshland and creeks. text:
Mr. Lexeous,
Your point about glacial ice melting not affecting the ocean isn't entirely correct. It has been estimated that the melting of ice caps and glaciers with ocean water will cause an average increase of sea level by about a meter. Glaciers are early indicators of climate change, because widespread loss of glaciers could alter established climate patterns. For example, glaciersâ€™ white surfaces that reflect sun rays helping to keep our current climate mild. When they melt, darker exposed surfaces absorb and release heat, raising temperatures. In Greenland, ocean circulation has been disrupted as icebergs brake off of glaciers, melting into the North Atlantic and decreasing density of the water. This phenomenon also decreases salinity, which can be extremely dangerous to ocean life.

Earth is heating up lately, but so are Mars, Pluto and other worlds in our solar system, leading some scientists to speculate that a change in the sunâ€™s activity is the common thread linking all these baking events.

author: á›áš¢áš¨áš± á›’á›–áš¨áš±

text:
Â @á›áš¢áš¨áš± á›’á›–áš¨áš±Â  No, Earth is NOT experiencing a natural phenomenon, unless you mean that CO2 is rising rapidly, and CO2 has, for a couple of billion years, been the regulator of GAST on Earth.  The atmosphere mostly doesn't care about the source of CO2 and methane, only the concentrations. 

Solar output has slightly diminished, about -2-3 watts/sq. meter, over the last 35 years, exactly as the GAST has risen rapidly, now exponentially.  And NO, the other planets are NOT heating up due to solar inputs.
Over very long time scales, the sun IS heating up.  It is expanding in size and the output is rising.  But that process is far too slow to be observable as heated lower troposphere on Earth.  If the sun was the source of heating, the expectation is that the upper troposphere would be heating, but there is not anywhere near enough heating there to be contributing significantly to SURFACE heating.  Besides, we have some excellent solar monitoring satellites, like SOHO, which very accurately measure the output and activity of the sun in the spectrum from X-ray to UV to visible light to near infrared to far infrared to radio spectrum.  There has not been an increase in output sufficient to move the GAST.
So, IT'S NOT THE SUN.  The only other source of the substances that ARE causing the heating is human activity.     QED

text: Â @BREADED CHICKENÂ  Nobody says that there are not excursions from the trend due to natural forcing change.  But they were relatively minor climate events.  Nowhere NEAR to what is underway now.  This began in earnest in 1979, and part of the rise is the inclusion of satellite data in that year which greatly increased the potential for accuracy and much greater, global, coverage.  Better data yields better conclusions.

text: He said  "greenhouse gases trap the heat in"? Not true. Co2 has a specific gravity of 1.5 and air has a SG of 1.0, which means Co2 is heavier than air and does not rise up and create a heat trapping canopy, but falls down to the ground. Helium is lighter than air and it's why helium balloons float. Try filling a balloon with Co2 and see what happens, it will sink to the ground. Even if Co2 could float up and create a heat trapping canopy, which it can't, Co2 has been proven to not trap heat. The only experiment to see if Co2 trapped heat found that it did not trap heat or prevent heat from escaping the earth into outer space. This experiment was done by climate changers, hoping to prove that it did trap heat, but found out the opposite. Our temps and climate are controlled by the sun and in 2011 we witnessed some of the largest flares ever seen on the sun. The very next day we had record highs around the world.

text: Â @Meri IÂ  You'll have to decide for yourself.  But the information is out there.  Since 1880 the earth's temperature has risen .3% (three TENTHS of a percent) -- which is amazingly stable. And, the fact is, humans have never had it this good!  Have you failed to notice that NONE of the "global warming" models they predicted have come true? So now they call it "climate change". Did you know it takes 30 years to define a "climate" -- and that climate ALWAYS changes? Do you really think man kind can measure the ENTIRE planet's temperature to a tenth of a degree, year after year and decade after decade, reliability? Of course not.  Do you think humans KNOW the optimal temperature of the earth?  Of course not. Do you know where these thermometers are placed and how many per continent? Because the temp readings are not evenly placed, or even close.  Did you know there's more ice in the south pole than ever? Did you know there's actually been no global warming for the last 18 years if you don't include the temperature of the ocean? Did you know that they didn't include the temperature of the oceans in their calculation except for the last 100 years (which is the only way they can say that global warming is occurring)?? If CO2 increased half as much since 1998 until now, as compared to the previous 100 years, then how come no global warming has occurred since? Did you know CO2 is better for crop yield -- so much so that farmers pump it into green houses? See -- they never talk about the positives -- only the doomsday scenarios.  Did you know that the raise in the sea level has been constant over the last 300 years (well BEFORE industrialization)? Did you know there's no actually been NO increase in US land-based hurricanes since at least 1851? Did you know that tornado count in the US has remained stable since 1954? It's common sense stuff, man.  They are pumping you full of BS when you do a little more digging you will see.

text: One thing they don't mention here that the current science says: The computer modelling shows that the Earth is warming so quickly that extinction rates will reach 100%.  That means everything and everyone will be dead, not from the heat itself but from ecosystem collapse.  More realistically that means that it will be closer to 99% extinction rates.   The last time we had a greenhouse gas die off was  Permian Triassic extinction where a much slower release of greenhouse gases killed off 96% of all species.  This is happening much faster though, so fast that trees and ocean life won't be able to adapt, so a 99-100% extinction rates are what is being calculated.  They don't mention this in the news report because they don't want to cause panic.

text: Â @Citizen 1Â  Yeah. Humans have a terrible time dealing with issues of tremendous scale when it comes to time and space. We don't notice our hair growing. We notice that it has grown. One of science's many benefits to humanity is the improved ability to predict outcomes that we would ignore based only on our day-to-day experience. Melville thought it was impossible that humans could endanger whales because the ocean was so vast, and cetaceans so plentiful in the 19th century. Given additional data, it should have been plain we were participating in a near-extinction event unless practices were changed. This is not to say that scientists are always right in these predictions: new discoveries or data could always alter our projections. But when there is a credible risk, and we do nothing about it, we are ourselves culpable in whatever terrifying outcome results.

text:
Â @Kelli BarnhouseÂ  Trees are essentially "batteries" ... they only store carbon gas. If those trees are taken out, all those carbon will return to the atmosphere. Best way is to put the carbon back underground where we found them. As for Methane gases and among other less common ones, tree farms don't work on those greenhouse gases.
We'd have to wait until we can do nuclear fusion and terraforming to fully reverse climate change. Until then, all we can do is halt our carbon footprint while advancing our technological capacity.


Also desert regions in the U.S. are natural. Barren soil isn't. I think you're getting those two region types mixed up. Desert can still house life, else nothing would be out there. Barren region are usually soil with exhausted nutrients. Thus nothing will grow.



Tree farms is a solution, but it isn't a good solution to heavily invest. Nuclear energy is a way better investment so that we can still obtain energy while reducing environmental damage significantly. When we switch to thorium reactors of course. The U.S. can afford to replace our current radiation dump nuclear reactors to modern thorium-based nuclear reactors. Once energy issue is resolved, we can start reducing natural gases other non-renewable energy production in the U.S. With that, further reducing our country's carbon emissions.

text:
Â @Boston quadÂ  I don't believe there is anything to fix. Global warming due to the impact of mankind is fabricated. Yes, the climate changes. We once had an Ice Age on this planet. The planet once favored reptiles to thrive and grow to extreme sizes. The climate is always going to change on this planet and it's the organisms that can adapt to the changes that survive. Everyone who believes in this notion of global warming has also forgotten something we learned in elementary school. Most large, land dwelling organisms inhale oxygen and exhale carbon dioxide. Most land dwelling plants absorb carbon dioxide and emit oxygen. So, firstly, the source of the production of carbon dioxide does not affect the CO2 that is emitted. Carbon dioxide is still carbon dioxide whether I emit it or a gas powered car emits it. It, therefore, can not be harmful when emitted from the burning fossil fuels. Finally, if you observe greenhouses that inject carbon dioxide into the structure, you will see the recommended levels, measured in p.p.m., of carbon dioxide will exceed the current measured levels of carbon dioxide in our atmosphere. So, if you believe that carbon dioxide is harmful to our environment, then you must be against all emissions of carbon dioxide, no matter the source. You must cease to exhale immediately. Our environment is dependent upon your cooperation!
Now, I can only assume you are in a more urban setting than I. I base this on your profile name. Being in a rural area, the only decent paying jobs in my area are manufacturing. This means my wife must travel further to have the incredible job that she has and was able to acquire due to her degree. With her full time employment, I am responsible for the children. We have to be in two places at the same time while living in a rural area with no public transportation. How does only having one vehicle allow us to thrive as a family? Our country is in a massive amount of debt. The construction of public transportation to every city registering at even a moderate population would cost more than our current deficit. So, what do you propose as an alternative for my family after you have removed one of our means of transportation?

text:
Â @Jamey CraigÂ  You just went on this entire tangent that went in a complete circle and included no useful information. You say I'm wrong in the way I believe, then show me how I'm wrong. You wanna bring up that science has proven it is happening? I'll bring up the April 16, 1970 article published in The Boston Globe which stated we would be in an Ice Age by the beginning of the 21st century. That rhetoric continued until 1988 when, all of a sudden, the narrative switched to rising sea levels due to global warming. But scientists are always correct with their "science-y" stuff and numbers right? Yet, I don't need a parka to walk outside nor a boat to get to the store. Over the last 30 years, the "global warming craze" begin to lose traction. They thought, "Oh, let's just relabel and repackage the same product and the people will eat it up." Well, it worked! But, they did finally find the correct term for this "phenomenon of human intervention" that has occurred since our planet came into existence. The climate has changed many times on our planet and guess what? There's "science-y" stuff to prove that too! So your favored scientist says one thing, and my favored scientist says the opposite. Both have "facts" to prove it. So, who's wrong then if scientists are the credible deciding factor? So, since we come to a stalemate at the scientists, we must use our own logical thinking to determine what we think is correct. I've stated in earlier comments that I base my conclusions on what we learned at a young age. We exhale CO2 and plants absorb it. Then in chemistry, you learn that an element is that element based upon the protons, neutrons, and electrons and the structure that they create. An element or compound then can not somehow change to be harmful in one scenario and the same compound then deemed safe in other scenarios. Therefore, carbon dioxide can not be harmful to our environment. If it was, the exhaling of trillions of organisms on earth would have caused significant damage to our atmosphere over the millions of years that these oxygen breathing organisms have existed. Yes, that does include humans. So, in conclusion, yet again, you have provided zero substance relative to the topic. You have actually done exactly what you just described in your last comment where you have tried to talk to even your own son, yet they refuse to be open to your opposing view. You instead took the cop out of, "There's no point in arguing with someone who is convinced." I interpret your entire comment as YOU being the one who is "set in your ways" and unwilling to engage in civil dialogue because your "facts" are easily argued and hearing someone counter your argument triggers an emotional response that you do not have the will power to suppress. For example, I called you out for replying to everyone with no substance and pure belittlement. "You uneducated willfully ignorant climate denier!" Someone who can hear, or in this case to read, a statement that upsets or offends them, suppress their emotional response to the statement, and remain on topic shows a stronger will than the individual who allows that emotional response to control their actions. 

By the way, I'm only 29 years old. Your son sounds like he needs someone whom he could relate to more than his dad. His own father is willing to throw him under the bus to a complete stranger so his father can put himself on a pedestal. That is quite discouraging. It's more discouraging, and frankly, pathetic, that I, a 29 year old father of two, is having to tell you how to speak and conduct yourself civilly, especially when referencing your own son.

text: Â @GANTZ100ptsÂ  Maybe you are imagining some apocalyptic scenario that you will wake up one morning and everything will be on fire, but that is simply not the case. Yes, people were talking about climate change 15 years ago. And we are now dealing with those impacts. The 1997 IPPC report predicted that rising temperatures threatened polar and Greenland's ice sheets. Today, glacial shifts and melting sheets have had tangible impacts. Maybe not to you and your neighborhood, but entire villages have been uprooted since their farms no longer can survive and their resources are being destroyed. Countless reports predicted decades ago that the rising level of CO2 and other pollutants threatened our air quality. Now, each year 8 million people die prematurely due to air pollution-related causes. The impacts are happening now. I can go on and on. Just because people may live in a country that has the ability to adapt better to climate changes and be more resilience, poorer nations are absolutely feeling the cost of climate change.

text:
Â @Brian SiegelÂ  CO2 has no effect on climate.  There is ZERO evidence for it.  It has been warmer in the past when there was less CO2.  It has been colder in the past when there was less CO2.  CO2 is irrelevant. 

Gas temperature has nothing to do with the content of the gas.  PV=nRT.  The volume of our atmosphere changes only a tiny amount.  The pressure only changes a tiny amount.  The ONLY thing that can affect the temperature of the gas is how much energy is being put in vs. how much escapes.  The atmosphere is NOT a greenhouse.  It is OPEN to space.  Heat escapes the same way it arrives, VIA RADIATION.  There is nothing to capture that radiation.  If CO2 warms up, it warms up the air around it which in turn RADIATES into space until equilibrium is reached. 

The IPCC has now switched gears and they will finally allow for charged particle forcing into the models.  That changes everything.  Clouds and their modulation of earth's albedo are not included in the models presently, but their impact on climate is huge.
author: t00by00zer

text: Â @t00by00zerÂ  PV=nRT has absolutely nothing to do with the greenhouse effect, which is the reason CO2 plays a role in warming, not because of an ideal gas law. Also PV=nRT calculations do not work in the atmosphere wholistically because it is the atmosphere, not an imaginary box. But good use of your physics homework, A+. I'm assuming you don't know about the infrared emitting of CO2, hence not about the  greenhouse effect. Interesting you know about ideal gas laws but not about the properties of a basic gas. And clouds and albedo are absolutely factors, water vapor is the most abundant greenhouse gas (although its origins are not manmade unlike a significant amount of CO2). I'm glad you are using what you learned in your intro to physics class about albedo and PV=nRT but you are using it in the wrong applications. Also a tip for your next physics test, PV=nRT is the ideal gas law and works for hypothetical gases. It is more or less not applicable to practical applications of gases, especially those in uncontrolled environments like the atmosphere.
author: Brian Siegel

text: Â @t00by00zerÂ  Also aside from the fact that the claim CO2 has no impact on climate is like so hilariously false, the idea that it has been warmer in the past with lower CO2 levels assumes that 1) CO2 is the only cause of temperature changes and 2) that warmer temperatures and less CO2 somehow means that CO2 has NO impact. Those ideas are more idiotic than the rejection that CO2 plays a role in climate change. Who is your teacher????
author: Brian Siegel

text:
Â @Brian SiegelÂ  greenhouses rely on an insulating layer between the atmosphere of the greenhouse and the outside world.  The earth does not possess such a barrier.
There is no greenhouse effect in an atmosphere exposed to outer space.  It will radiate that heat to space just like it receives it from the sun.
If the energy from the sun is constant (and the idiot models think that's true) then the atmosphere cannot increase its temperature in violation of PV=nRT.  The system cannot do work on itself to raise its temperature.

text:
Â @t00by00zerÂ  We have plenty available to replace fossil fuels.  The first step is to electrify as many things as we can.  Then, as the power grid relies less on fossil fuel, the things that connect to it automatically use less fossil fuel.  

The cost of lithium batteries has fallen over 80% just since 2010 and is still dropping, making electric vehicles more and more affordable.  Almost every multi-vehicle family could make at least one of their vehicles electric without compromising their lifestyle in any way.  They would even save money on fuel and maintenance, and have the convenience of home charging.

Homeowners and businesses that haven't done so already can install heat pumps and heat pump water heaters to save on their natural gas bill.

Obviously homeowners can switch to LED lighting and save a lot of money that way, with zero compromises.

The grid is rapidly getting greener.  People don't realize it, but the cost of wind and solar has fallen through the floor, making it very competitive.  The majority of new power generation this year (2019) is forecast by the US government to be wind and solar.  That's amazing.  Coal plants are rapidly being retired, with coal's share of power generation plummeting by half in the past couple decades.  Batteries have gotten cheap enough that they're starting to displace natural gas peaker plants to handle peak evening and morning loads.

This is all happening already, but to minimize risk to the climate and to reduce the health effects and other effects of air pollution we should accelerate it.  Are you opposed to reducing risk, even if there's only a 5% risk of catastrophic global warming?  Isn't reducing risk of low percentage negative outcomes something you do all the time in the normal course of living?  Are you opposed to reducing health damaging air pollution?  Do you think that you and I aren't negatively affected by sitting in a traffic jam or walking near busy city traffic with all those cars, trucks, and buses pumping out poisonous gases?  We all benefit from taking these actions.

text:
Â @t00by00zerÂ  "what do you think we use to create the electricity?"

The main sources are coal, natural gas, nuclear, hydro, wind and solar.  But, as I said, it is getting greener.  Coal is down from its peak of around 50% to now around 25%, and continuing to fall.  Natural gas (which releases around half the carbon of coal) has been increasing, but is starting to plateau.  Nuclear has been steady at around 20% for a long time.  Hydro is steady.  Wind and solar are increasing, and represent the majority of new power generation.  That's very significant.  I'm not sure why you dismiss it.

"There isn't enough sunlight or wind to generate the electrical energy we need now, much less what we would need if everyone drove electric cars."

There's plenty, and their eventual takeover is an economic certainty since wind and solar are getting cheaper and cheaper while fossil fuels are not.  This is especially true for solar, which can take advantage of mass production efficiencies similar to what computer chips cheaper and cheaper.

"Do you understand how efficient it is to carry energy around in the form of liquid gasoline?  The amount of battery space/weight/cost to replace a 400 mile tank of gas is LUDICROUS!!!"

I understand perfectly.  Batteries are much heavier than a tank full of gasoline.  However, an electric motor and simple single speed gear reduction transmission are way lighter than an equivalent gasoline or diesel engine and multi-speed transmission.  A battery doesn't store as much energy, but an electric motor is way more efficient than a gasoline engine at turning that energy into motion.  The end result is that overall a 300+ mile EV is only marginally heavier than a comparable gasoline vehicle (a Tesla Model 3 weighs 3800 lbs.  A BMW 335i weighs 3500 lbs).  Batteries are dropping in price and getting more dense every year, so the issues of cost and weight, will disappear before too long, making practical 400+ mile range for those who need it.

"Do you know how environmentally unfriendly it is to mine Lithium?"

All resource extraction causes environmental damage.  There's nothing particularly unique about lithium.  At least lithium is put into durable goods that last years, not consumed once and then gone.

"Burning coal and natural gas to release CO2 is NOT HARMFUL.  [...]  It has no effect on climate." 

An assertion without evidence and contrary to the scientific consensus.  At the very least, you have to acknowledge that you cannot say with 100% confidence that there is absolutely no risk.  Nobody can.  If there is risk, and the cost to reduce risk is small, it makes sense to do it.

"China and India are building 20 new coal plants for every one we retire.

CO2 is not air pollution.  Our coal plants do not pollute the air."

Those countries are dichotomies.  They are making huge strides in renewable energy, while continuing to build polluting coal plants.  But their use of coal is nothing we want to emulate.  They are killing their own people by the thousands with air pollution from vehicles and coal power plants.  I was in China a few years ago, and the pollution is truly awful.  Our coal plants are cleaner, but all coal plants emit air pollution (not just CO2), and generate huge amounts of coal ash.  Switching to renewables has huge benefits that have nothing to do with CO2.

You can't have a greenhouse without an insulating layer between the inside of the greenhouse and the outside.  Earth is open to space. text:
Sorry UN, saying it's so doesn't make it so.

Those who use the term "climate change" are really using it as a shorthand for Catastrophic Anthropogenic Global Warming (CAGW). There is no sense in which CAGW is real.

1) There is no statistically significant measurable rise in the average global temperature in the last 20 years despite the increase in CO2. Some localities actually show a decrease. We're definitely not seeing unprecedented temperature highs, increased storm activity or any other predicted effects of global warming. Hurricanes, tornadoes, droughts, floods, etc. are all down in recent years compared to the past, not up. Stations that are unambiguously warming are almost invariably doing so due to the urban heat island effect or other siting issue, not any global cause.

2) The measurable rise in the average global temperature between 1970 and 2000 still did not rise as high as the average global temperature in the 1930s. There was enough of a global cooling between 1940 and 1970 that it scared scientists enough to declare the possibility that we might be entering another ice age. We still haven't fully recovered to the temperatures of the "Grapes of Wrath" Dust Bowl era that caused the only known climate refugee migration in recorded history since the Norse abandoned Greenland. I'm not yet seeing Midwest farmers abandoning their farms in droves and moving to California in 2019.

3) Even the 1930s was only a local maximum in the average global temperature. We've had warmer periods in recorded history, and warmer periods in prehistory for which we can find reliable evidence in surrogates. (Ice core measurements of CO2, by the way, are not reliable and understate the variability and absolute amount of CO2 at the time of ice formation.)

4) The demise of Arctic sea ice has been repeatedly predicted and yet it still remains extant long after the predicted dates for its demise and the Arctic is still almost entirely closed to commercial sea traffic. Similar hysteria has been drummed up over land ice in Antarctica and Greenland, yet their ice remains as well. It's simply not true that we're losing anomalous amounts of polar ice in any of these regions, let alone all three (which would be required of any "global" phenomenon). It also needs to be noted that sea ice cannot cause sea level rise, only land ice can do that.

5) NASA, NOAA and other bodies have been caught altering their data to introduce the very trends they are supposedly trying to detect. Such alterations are unscientific and need to be rejected. When they don't bother to alter the data, they begin their graphs at the last low in the measurements: the 1970s. This is cherry picking and needs to be called out.

6) The IPCC models are demonstrably wrong. Continued use of them is unscientific. They need to be rejected. The vicious cycle positive feedback mechanism that they depend on for their catastrophic predictions simply does not exist. CO2 rises follow temperature rises, thus they cannot initiate temperature rises. The IPCC knows this, they claim that CO2 rise exacerbates and prolongs a temperature rise. If the feedback cycle actually existed as the IPCC says, then past known global heat waves would not have stopped and we'd not be here. This planet would already be another Venus.

7) The greenhouse gas theory upon which the IPCC models rest is unproven. There is an alternative (better) scientific theory that says it cannot be true. It's a well-known physics law (ideal gas law) that says gas temperature rises with pressure. If we compute how much temperature rise can be expected at the earth's surface due to gravity-induced pressure, there is no need for the greenhouse theory. All the temperature rise can be accounted for by atmospheric pressure, leaving none for the greenhouse theory. The ideal gas law can be used to account for the anomalous heat at the surface of Venus as well as the surface of the earth, this despite the fact that Venus's greenhouse gases are orders of magnitude greater than earth's.

8) Even if the greenhouse theory is true, according to the theory the climate is only logarithmically sensitive to CO2. In other words, if it could be proven that average global temperature rose 1 degree Celsius exclusively because of a CO2 doubling from 200 ppmv to 400 ppmv, then it would take another doubling from 400 ppmv to 800 ppmv to produce the next 1 degree Celsius rise. Thus we can safely double CO2 from slightly more than 400 ppmv at present to 800 ppmv by 2100 and still only be in danger of a 1 degree Celsius rise by then, which would by no means be catastrophic. It would not be enough to cause large amounts of polar land ice to melt and create any noticeable rise in sea levels. It would actually be beneficial to plant growth in most populated regions of the world, thus increasing food supply for both humans and animals.

9) Increased CO2 itself is beneficial to plant life. We've already seen (via satellite imagery) that the planet is greening and deserts are growing smaller. Real greenhouses deliberately triple the CO2 inside them (raise internal air from 400 ppmv CO2 to 1200 ppmv) so the plants breathe much easier and expire less water vapor, thus cutting down on the amount of water they need to thrive. The last thing we should ever allow leftists to do would be to sequester atmospheric CO2.

10) Scientists measure atmospheric CO2 at Mauna Loa, which everyone agrees is as accurate as modern technology will allow. But they cannot and do not measure the human contribution to atmospheric CO2. The IPCC was chartered only to consider human contributions to climate change, thus, they deliberately mislead people into thinking that the entire CO2 rise is due to human activity when that is certainly not true. We know that the oceans release CO2 when they warm, and that effect is about 16 times more powerful than anything we puny humans can collectively muster. Certain isotopes are assumed to be due to human activity, but there is no proof of that, it's merely an assumption. The IPCC also assumes that CO2 stays in the atmosphere for much longer periods than is likely to be the case. There are very good scientific reasons to think that the anthropogenic portion of the greenhouse gases has been vastly exaggerated in the public mind, and natural origins have been downplayed. Note also that CO2 is not the only or even the primary greenhouse gas. According to the theory, most of the greenhouse effect is due to water vapor and clouds, not CO2, yet nobody is at all upset about the water vapor we humans emit.

text: So everybody picks on the U.S.    The U.S. is responsible for a whopping 17 percent of the CO2 contribution to the atmosphere in parts per million according to "scientists".    Uh, but wait.   Only 3 percent to as much as 5 percent(which means they don't actually know for sure) of all the CO2 in parts per million is caused by humans(according to the same scientists).   Basic math, 17 percent of 3 to 5 percent of 400 is 2.4 molecules of CO2 to 3.04 molecules of CO2 per million molecules of air.   I would note also that I have never seen that percentage calculated except in 100 percent DRY air.   That means absolutely no water vapor is present in the test sample.   In most places over the surface of the planet there is water vapor in the air.   It is true that there are some some places where water vapor is not present but you wouldn't want to live there.   So, back to America, even at 2.4 to 3.04 CO2's per million, the U.S. could become totally carbon neutral and have no affect on the CO2 level of the planet.    India and China are making sure of that.    They were both given "exemptions" to CO2 emission limits in the Paris climate accords.    Why would they do that and then expect the U.S. to pay billions into that particular venture?

text:
The problem with funding research to prove 1 outcome is that it creates an incredible bias and continuation of funding to further that narrative.

That is largely how climate science has functioned in recent times.

We've only been able to closely observe and record the world's climate for about 50 years. The truth is the vast majority of what we are experiencing we DO NOT KNOW the cause for sure. 40 years ago it was global cooling, now it's global warming. When you look back throughout historical drawings and such we see ancient warnings and predictions that depict the same 2 things. Ice age or we all burn.

IMO based on ONLY what we know for sure, this climate change seems to be a naturally occurring cycle in Earth. What causes it to shift we have no idea, but the longer we pay scientists to prove that coal is bad the longer we stay stagnant in our search for truth.

text:
Â @kc CoxÂ  
1) Climate change goes far beyond weather
2) There are probably 1,000's of scientists with degrees who are smart who are skeptical towards many mainstream ideas about climate change. However, much of that skepticism may be pointed towards estimations of when and how bad the effects will be when they happen. Most scientists will not claim that climate change is a hoax from top to bottom, and even if they do, you shouldn't care. There are millions of other scientists who don't have an agenda who mostly agree with the primary narrative. There's virtually nothing 100% of scientists agree on, the scientific community is based upon consensus, it isn't a hive mind. 
3) The "elite" aren't making sacrifices, but neither are most people from the middle and lower classes. Also, I don't see how this matters, it doesn't make climate science less true. 
4) You claim that the rich somehow benefit from propagating the idea of climate change, yet the reverse can be said of oil companies and this is more of a proven fact since Exxon-mobile on record has purposely seeded doubt in climate change science since the 70's. Same tactics cigarette companies pulled to try and convince people that cigarettes don't cause cancer and are actually healthy for you. I recommend looking for a book/documentary called "merchants of doubt" for further information.
5) You can see for yourself the ice-sheet decay in Greenland and the Antarctic. Don't take my word for it, look at the data yourself, its all easily accessible online.

Fossils of sea creatures have been found on Mount Everest. Most of this so-called science are just hypotheses. Learn to think for yourself and do your own research instead of believing the religion of Woke.
author: Stephen Anthony

text: Â @Stephen AnthonyÂ  Its not coincidence when you have a large enough spectrum of data to look at. If it was just one or two fossils found then you could make that argument. I wouldn't be surprised to hear sea creatures were found on Everest. To explain it well I have to discuss some principles of plate tectonics. The Indian-Austrialian plate is mostly underneath the ocean. As magma rises from underwater volcanoes, it forms new crust and makes the old crust slide outward away from the emersion point. This process will force "old" crust to be pushed until they hit a different plate and then you have a conversion boundary. This is where mountains are formed and its why Everest could have sea creature fossils on/in it.

text:
Â @ShimrraÂ  There are an estimated 16,000,000 scientists worldwide. Of those, 300,000 or so identify themselves as climate scientists. You keep referencing this 'consensus'. Can you direct me to the database where all of these people weighed in?


Also, here's temperature over the last 10,000 years: https://jonova.s3.amazonaws.com/graphs/lappi/gisp-last-10000-new-a.gif


Current times are on the far right. Please note, the 29 peaks proceeding that point above our current levels. Please also note the lowest lows of many of those periods are also higher than our current temperatures. Notice how the 'rate of warming' is also comparable to any other spike. Last but not least, also note how the warm peaks coincide with golden ages of historical human civilization. 


Your heart is in a good place, I get it. But you really need to stop reading into the hype. If you want to make a case for not throwing so much trash all over the place and driving species into predation,  we'd probably find a lot of common ground. But AGW is largely a political issue supported by theoretical prediction models that have NEVER lined up with the observable data. Not even one time in more than 50 years of these doomsday predictions. If something wants to be a 'fact', it has do be demonstrable through experimentation with predictable results. As much as you might like to believe your side gets to claim the high ground of the  burden of proof argument, I'm afraid you are just flat out incorrect.
